results.title: Unguarded moments
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description: Based on travel to Italy, Holland, and around the United States, Unguarded Moments records a series of visual phenomena created physically when nature and technology collide. Repetitive images of the Lubavitcher rebbe, trains, swans, and human gestures combine as a series of sound and movement experiments, as well as social observations, using low-end video and computer processing systems.
results.description: Based on travel to Italy, Holland, and around the United States, Unguarded Moments records a series of visual phenomena created physically when nature and technology collide. results.title: Just hold still. Parts one and two
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, black and white and colour and audio
results.brief_description: In his New York City Landscape, Cohen finds inspiration in disturbance. Looking to life for rhythm and to architecture for state of mind, he locates simple mysteries. `Just Hold Still’ is comprised of an interconnected series of short works and collaborations that explore the grey area between documentary, narrative and experimental genres. Part One concerns a personal, poetic approach to narrative while Part Two involves hybridized use of verite footage and the confrontation of documentary concerns with the music video format. The work can be considered as a whole or each piece in the project can be viewed (and rented) as a separate entity.

results.title: L'île Mystérieruse
results.brief_description: French videomaker Cahen eloquently captures atmospherics to create a sound and colour scape of Easter Island, The Mysterious Island. He writes, ‘Traversed by light and colors, images of the empty landscape seem to be haunted by a gaze, a desire to see, to know.’ Children play in the shallows of a small boat harbour. Is this a clue to the mystery?

results.title: Notes from the underground
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description: The displaced eye of an unyielding, handheld camera studies the faces, hands and feet of commuters on the London Underground. The sequence begins as the train is leaving Temple Station, a center for the city’s law practises and named for the Order of the Knights Templars, the suppressed Medieval Order from which the Freemasons claim decent. A middle-aged commuter pulls a variety of bored expressions while Asher’s camera focuses on the gold signet ring he wears, a symbol of a Freemason. Successive characters show differing reactions, to the presence of the camera which has a pervasive power that admits no concessions to the rhythmic progress of daily routines.

results.title: LDTV
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description: LDTV, refers to the artist’s term for ‘low definition television’. This work is a collection of television fragments videotaped directly from the TV screen in an array of countries in which Asher has travelled. On the one hand LDTV reflects the nomadic character of Asher’s work, but at the same time it reproduces the effect of a satellite fixed in space, giving unlimited access to a homogenised world. With vitality and humor, LDTV traces the speed at which Western culture is transmitted globally.

results.title: Preserving native grasslands
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept of Conservation, Forests and Lands and Conservation Forrest and Lands
results.brief_description: This program examines the problem of our disappearing native grasslands due to the urban sprawl, introduced species and weeds. The department of Conservation, Forests and Land have put out a booklet promoting public awareness of native plants (grasses, flowers and herbs), when and how to identify them, and the various steps involved in preserving them. No other credits available.

results.title: More or less: a film about food
results.creator_credit: Healthsharing Women. Publishing and Production Group, Paddy Stitt and Lawrie Whittle
results.brief_description: Andrew Daddo outlines the “More or less” diet which is advocated by the Life Be In It campaign as a plan for eating for the “rest of your life”. By choosing carefully from the five basic food groups and eating more bread, cereals, fruit and vegetables, and less sugar, fat and salt, and exercising regularly, more children can became aware of the choices involved in planning a balanced diet.

results.title: Visions of perfection
results.creator_credit: Prahran School Support Centre, TV Ed Productions and Diane Charleson
results.brief_description: The Victoria College of the Arts provides a venue for talented children in the performing arts of music and dance to combine these with their academic studies in a high school setting. A student violinist, percussionist, ballet dancer and pianist talk about the courses available and demonstrate some of the activities in the school.

results.title: Handicap is something you put on a horse
results.creator_credit: Marjorie Fisher, Joan Reidy, I E A and Peter Brighton
results.brief_description: A documentation of the successful integration of a physically disabled person into the field of journalism. Stresses the importance of commencing the integration pocess at an early age and mantaining the integrated contact as the dissabled person matures.
